main event: Three distinct circular objects were observed passing rapidly across the sky in Brookville, Long Island, New York on July 4, 1960.
interesting points: The objects were in view for approximately 1 1/2 minutes and kept a constant formation.
One of the three objects changed course, while the other two remained on the same course.
The objects were described as having a pearly, glistening reflection and being larger than a car headlight.
One witness said the edges of the objects were fuzzy, while another witness said they saw the impression of whirling rings around the objects.
The objects were estimated to be traveling at a speed between 1,500 to 2,000 mph.
witnesses: a married couple and one neighbor
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
